intro: Dolicholus texanus, commonly known as the Texas spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, producing a distinctive yellowish-green color.
